alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 5:30PM EDT until June 28 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Maine, including the following counties, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms and rain showers. This will cause small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. This area is prime for additional flooding due to the extreme rain that fell across the same area this past Monday morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andover, Weld, Byron, Roxbury and South Arm.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
